conclusion: Need to analyze the acceleration-time graph to determine the elevator's state at t=4.5 seconds.
Graph shows acceleration of the elevator over time; positive acceleration indicates upward motion, negative indicates downward, zero indicates constant velocity.

At t=0, elevator starts from rest with zero initial velocity; from t=0 to t=4 seconds, acceleration is positive and constant at 2 m/s²; at t=4 seconds, acceleration drops to zero; from t=4 to t=5 seconds, acceleration is negative and constant at -2 m/s².
At t=4 seconds, elevator reaches maximum velocity because acceleration is zero; from t=4 to t=5 seconds, elevator decelerates due to negative acceleration of -2 m/s².
Velocity at t=4 seconds is 8 m/s.
Velocity at t=4.5 seconds is 7 m/s.
At t=4.5 seconds, elevator is ascending but decelerating; acceleration is -2 m/s², indicating a downward force greater than gravitational force, resulting in weightlessness.
At t=4.5 seconds, the elevator is in a state of weightlessness.
